  • Uses of Vec3 in camzup.core

    Fields in camzup.core declared as Vec3 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Vec3 Knot3.coord
    The spatial coordinate of the knot.
    Vec3 Vert3.coord
    The coordinate of the vertex in world space.
    Vec3[] Mesh3.coords
    An array of coordinates.
    Vec3 Ray3.dir
    The ray's direction.
    Vec3 Knot3.foreHandle
    The handle which warps the curve segment heading away from the knot along the direction of the curve.
    Vec3 Quaternion.imag
    The coefficients of the imaginary components i, j and k.
    Vec3 Vec3.SortDistSq.locus
    The point against which distances are compared.
    Vec3 Bounds3.max
    The maximum corner.
    Vec3 Bounds3.min
    The minimum corner.
    Vec3 Vert3.normal
    The direction in which light will bounce from the surface of the mesh at the vertex.
    Vec3[] Mesh3.normals
    An array of normals to indicate how light will bounce off the mesh's surface.
    Vec3 Ray3.origin
    The ray's origin point.
    Vec3 Knot3.rearHandle
    The handle which warps the curve segment heading towards the knot along the direction of the curve.

    static Vec3 Bounds3.containsExclusive​(Bounds3 b, Vec3 v, Vec3 target)
    Evaluates whether a point is within the bounding volume, excluding the bound's edges (i.e., the evaluation is made with greater than and less than).

    A boolean vector is returned; useful for cases where a point may be contained in one dimension but not in another.
    static Vec3 Bounds3.containsInclusive​(Bounds3 b, Vec3 v, Vec3 target)
    Evaluates whether a point is within the bounding volume, including the bound's edges (i.e., the evaluation is made with greater than or equal to and less than or equal to).

    A boolean vector is returned; useful for cases where a point may be contained in one dimension but not in another.

    static Vec3 Vec3.cross​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    The cross product returns a vector perpendicular to both a and b, and therefore normal to the plane on which a and b rest.

    a x b := ( ay bz - az by , az bx - ax bz , ax by - ay bx )

    The cross product is anti-commutative, meaning a x b = - ( b x a ) .

    static Vec3 Vec3.cross​(Vec3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
    The cross product returns a vector perpendicular to both a and b, and therefore normal to the plane on which a and b rest.

    a x b := ( ay bz - az by , az bx - ax bz , ax by - ay bx )

    The cross product is anti-commutative, meaning a x b = - ( b x a ) .

    Transform3 Transform3.lookAt​(Vec3 point, float step, Handedness handedness)
    Orients the transform to look at a target point.

    The transform eases toward the look at rotation because discontinuities arise with using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis.

    Orients the transform to look toward a direction.

    The transform eases toward the look at rotation because discontinuities arise with using a look at matrix when a transform's look direction is parallel with the world up axis.
